page.title: 01Landscape
page.content: The area we are covering is a rural one.It is predominately undulating grazing land for cattle and sheep with very few crops being grown.Within the area there are four settlements three of which are very small villages and one larger village.The largest of these settlements is called{Evenwood} and the smaller ones are{Ramshaw,Lands and{Morley. } Within the area there is a fairly large deciduous wood called{Cragwood}. And the river{Gaunless},which is a tributary of the river Wear,flows through the area.Also in the area one can follow the course of a disused railway line,which was once a branch line of the Stockton and Darlington Railway.
